title: Centre Director, ELS - Kuala Lumpur and UPM Serdang (2 vacancies)
description:
Are you passionate about enhancing the international student experience and helping students succeed in their academic journey? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic team at ELS Language Centres, Malaysia, as the Centre Director.

**Job Summary**

The Centre Director is responsible for the overall business operations, academic programme and management of the language centre.

**Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities:**

Entrepreneurial orientation (Responsible for overall budget ownership)

* Proactively report P&L status against financial objectives and identify anomalies
* Develop and meet KPI targets and other financial goals developed alongside Director of Operations.
* Propose innovative business opportunities to increase revenue or decrease costs

Communication and organizational skills

* Ensure that the company’s policies and procedures are followed.
* Submit required reports and data as requested
* Manage Centre’s financial controls.
* Ensure that centre funds and property are secure and accounted for

Customer orientation

* Develop and maintain strong links and relationships with stake holders (incl. university partner, different faculties within university, sponsors and agents)
* Further develop and implement student service offerings
* Develop quality student services that build community, drive and manage an agreed- upon retention % within the centre. Implement company retention and returners strategies.
* Ensure that the centre is known and respected by the university community, industry peers, and referral sources by doing centre-specific outreach

Academic management

* Developing and conducting the academic program in such a manner that it meets all standards of ELS Language Centres standardised curriculum.
* Hiring, training and supervising of instructional staff.
* Providing substitute and/or regular classroom instruction. Minimum 2 periods per day.
* Maintaining the instructional budget by staying within instructional-hour guidelines.
* Ordering and maintaining all instructional materials and staying within the academic materials budget.
* Supervising the placement, testing and evaluation of students.
* Scheduling classes, teachers and students based on approved template.
* Orienting new students to the academic program.
* Submitting required academic reports to universities and/or sponsors.
* Assisting with the management of special programs as assigned.

Strategic thinker

* Develop centre plans specifying goals, strategy, staffing, scheduling and identification of risks, contingency plans and allotment of resources
* Continually define ways to increase customer satisfaction and maintain lasting stakeholder relationships.
* Fostering team work (Manage, motivate, discipline, mentor and lead the team).
* Ensure rigorous performance management of team, with regular individual and team reviews. Utilize the MIT process to identify and drive Most Important Tasks.
* Lead, mentor and guide all staff
* Promote good personnel relations and compliance with Human Resources policies and manage staff in a fair and professional manner
* Recruit and retain qualified staff
* Assign duties and responsibilities and scope of authority to staff
* Provide opportunities for people to learn to work together as a team. Recognize and encourage behaviours that contribute to teamwork
* Promote activities that result in centre growth; work with various ELS departments for promotional activities resulting in centre growth

Other

* Promote and maintain a safe place to work, a clean and attractive atmosphere.
* Ensure compliance to all regulatory requirements, University, State and Federal laws.
* Ensure that the companies’ policies and procedures are followed
* Ensure the quality of the academic program and adherence to instructional standards
* Ensure that materials used are updated and professional in nature
* Perform other duties as necessary or assigned

**Minimum Job Requirements**

**Education:** Minimum academic qualification of a master’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university and experience in an appropriate field, or an equivalent combination of training and experience is necessary. Courses in business management, cross-cultural awareness, counseling and ESL preferred.

**Experience:** Minimum 3 years of management experience, including managing program with full supervisory responsibilities, including hiring and evaluating personnel, preferably in an ESL program.

**Competencies:**

* Business management acumen and decision-making ability
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* Customer service focus/orientation
* Problem solving
* Maintain academic standards and quality
* Managing change
* Strategic thinker
* Foster teamwork

**Travel Requirement:**Minimum amount of travel

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: RM5,000.00 - RM6,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Maternity leave
* Opportunities for promotion
* Parental leave
* Professional development

Schedule:

* Day shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Performance bonus

title: English Language Instructor (Part-Time with Full-Time Scale Schedule)
description:
Are you passionate about enhancing the international student experience and helping students succeed in their academic journey? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic team at ELS Language Centres, Malaysia, as a Part-Time Tutor.

**Job Summary**

Reporting directly to the Academic Director or Academic coordinator, the English Language Instructor (part-time) is responsible for planning, teaching and evaluating assigned classes in accordance with the ELS Language Centers curriculum with assistance from the AD or AC, Instructional Specialists and Senior English Language Instructors; for maintaining student class records; for fulfilling administrative duties as required and/or requested by the AD or AC; and for participating in professional development activities such as workshops, meetings and assisting Associate English Language Instructors.

**Job Duties**

* To teach any of the ELS academic programmes as assigned by the Academic Director or Academic Coordinator.
* To prepare lesson plans, exercises and tests.
* To test, evaluate and counsel the student regarding his/her classroom performance.
* To maintain a classroom environment conducive to learning.
* To coordinate instruction, attendance records and evaluation with other teachers.
* To know and adhere to Center policy and procedures and to communicate local policy to associate English Language Instructors.
* To complete administrative paperwork as required or requested.
* To maintain performance and attendance records.
* To maintain Center resource materials and files
* To refer non-academic problems to the appropriate person(s).
* To be willing to observe for purposes of professional development and to be observed in all facets of the programmes.
* To participate in administrative meetings and professional development activities.
* To participate in the employee evaluation process (classroom observations and follow-up discussions and the performance appraisal process).
* To provide Associate English Language Instructors with assistance.
* To develop and /or refine teaching materials at the local level.
* To participate in activities during the English Language Instructor’s scheduled class hours and when requested, to disseminate information about after-class activities
* To contribute to the maintenance of neat classrooms and a neat staff workroom and staff lounge.
* To substitute in emergency situations when there are no reasonable alternatives available to the AD or AC.

**Minimum Job Requirements**

**Education:** B.Ed / BA/BSc./ + CELTA or other TEFL/TESOL (Minimum 120 hours)

**Experience:** At least 5 years relevant ESL/EFL experience.

**Personal Characteristics:**

* Possess cultural sensitivity; personal satisfaction derived from and enthusiasm for teaching international students;
* Show empathy for the problems of learning English as a second language;
* Have good communication and organization skills.
* Possess a desire for continuous professional development and sharing of best practice
* Possess a commitment to high standards of delivery
* Possess a can-do attitude that supports the ELS brand position
* Practice respect for all

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From RM2,500.00 per month

title: Spanish Language Teacher
description:
Are you fluent in Spanish and passionate about teaching others? We are seeking a dedicated Spanish language teacher to join our team. As a Spanish language teacher, you will be responsible for providing high-quality instruction to students of various proficiency levels.

**Responsibilities:**

* Plan and deliver engaging Spanish language lessons tailored to the needs of individual students or groups.
* Foster a supportive and interactive learning environment that encourages student participation and growth.
* Assess student progress regularly and provide constructive feedback to facilitate improvement.
* Utilize a variety of teaching methods and resources to enhance comprehension and retention of the Spanish language.
* Collaborate with colleagues and administrators to develop curriculum, assessments, and instructional materials.
* Stay updated on developments in language teaching methodologies and incorporate innovative techniques into lessons.

**Requirements:**

* Native or near-native fluency in Spanish.
* Bachelor’s degree in Spanish language, education, linguistics, or a related field.
* Previous experience teaching Spanish to students of diverse backgrounds and proficiency levels.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to create a positive and inclusive learning environment.
* Certification in teaching Spanish as a foreign language (e.g., ELE certification) is preferred but not required.
* Passion for language teaching and a commitment to student success.

If you are enthusiastic about sharing your knowledge and expertise in the Spanish language and helping students achieve their language learning goals, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join our team and make a difference in the lives of aspiring Spanish speakers!

**To Apply:** Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and teaching philosophy. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: English/ESL Teacher - Malaysia
description:
Byron Recruitment is now accepting applications from professionally qualified teachers interested in joining one of **Malaysia's top International School Groups** in January 2025. With 3 campuses that offer Cambridge, Ontario and IB curricula; from **Primary to Secondary and including a College Matriculation Program**, there are many exciting and rewarding teaching opportunities in Malaysia.

  

Currently seeking an **English/ESL teacher**

  

We are looking for **Teachers with Canadian Qualifications** or those willing to obtain their Ontario College of Teachers Certificate (OCT)**.**

  

International teachers who's first language is English and who have completed a **Post Graduate Degree in Education, a Bachelor Degree in Education, a Diploma in Teaching / Education** or an equivalent in countries such as The UK, Canada, The US, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand or South Africa are invited to apply.

 **OCT, QTS and / or IB Qualifications and experience will be considered an asset.**

  

If you are looking for a new teaching experience in **South East Asia** and an opportunity to join a fast growing, learner centered international school group we want to hear from you. We are looking for teachers for all age groups and subjects. Intake sessions for new teachers take place twice a year - in **early July and again each January**.

  

If this job isn't what you are looking for, check out all our jobs at www.byronrecruitment.com/open-roles/

 **Requirements:**

* Professional Teacher Qualifications and Teaching license from countries such as Canada, The US, Ireland, The UK, Australia, New Zealand or South Africa
* First Language - English
* 2-years of teaching experience
* exceptions can be made for Canadian Qualified Teachers

 **Teacher Benefits:**

* Monthly Basic Salary: RM 11,620 - RM 16,960 per month
* Contract period: 12 month
* Allowances:
* SIS Teacher Allowance - RM 750 per month
* Welfare Allowance - RM 1,500 per month
* Family Allowance - up to RM 1,500 per month
* Return Flights
* Shipping Allowance
* Annual Flight Allowance
* Medical Leave : 14 days per calendar year
* Medical Insurance
* Personal Accident Insurance
* Accommodation: First 14 days upon first entry to the country
* Contract Extension Incentives: 2 to 3 months’ gross salary based on length of contract extension signed
* Retirement Fund - min. of 11% of salary contributed by each teacher and an additional 12% contribution from the school

 **About The Schools:**

**Sunway City - Kuala Lumpur**

* New, state of the art International School Campus (opened January 2023)
* Ontario, IB and IGCSE Curricula
* KG to 12
* Most teachers live within walking distance of the school
* New modern city with great public transit, entertainment and food options

 **Sunway College - Matriculation Programme**

* Housed on the grounds of Sunway College in Sunway City
* Providing Ontario Grade 12 school year for students to complete their Ontario Secondary School Diploma prior to attending university.

 **Iskandar, Johor Bahru**

* Ontario, Canada Curriculum and IBDP for Grades 11 and 12
* Pre-K to 12 school
* Small school with approximately 500 students.
* Most teachers live within walking distance of the school
* Linked to Singapore by causeways, Johor is known for it's beautiful beaches and rain-forest

 **Apply Now** through the link or email your CV to *teachers@byronrecruitment.com*

title: Preschool and nursery Teacher / Assistant
description:
***Certainly! Here's a more inspiring version of your recruitment information:***

---

\*\*Join Our Team of Passionate Educators as a Preschool Teacher and Make a Difference!\*\*

We are thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for a Preschool Teacher to become a part of our esteemed institution. With over a decade of excellence in early childhood education, our school is renowned for its commitment to quality education and nurturing care for young children.

At our school, we believe in investing in our greatest asset – our staff. We prioritize the well-being of our team members and are dedicated to their professional development. By providing ample opportunities for growth and further education, we ensure that our educators are equipped with the skills and knowledge to excel. We foster a collaborative environment where every voice is heard, and everyone has the chance to thrive.

As a Preschool Teacher at our institution, you will have the opportunity to craft and deliver innovative, engaging lesson plans, build meaningful relationships with our young learners, and leave a lasting positive impact on their lives. We are looking for a passionate, skilled, and experienced individual who is committed to offering the highest standard of care and education to our students.

Join us in our mission to inspire and educate the next generation of leaders, thinkers, and changemakers. Together, we can create a brighter future.

Apply today and embark on a rewarding journey with us!

--- ***\*\*Job Responsibilities:\*\**** **- \*\*Develop and Execute Activities:\*\*** Create and implement age-appropriate activities that stimulate young children's development and learning.

**- \*\*Provide Nurturing Care:\*\*** Offer attentive and nurturing care to children under your supervision, ensuring their well-being and safety.

**- \*\*Adhere to Curriculum:\*\*** Follow lesson plans and curriculum guidelines consistently to provide structured and effective learning experiences.

**- \*\*Maintain Records:\*\*** Keep accurate and detailed records of teaching plans, children's progress, and any assessments conducted.

**- \*\*Parent Communication:\*\*** Regularly communicate with parents regarding their children's development, behavior, and any concerns.

**- \*\*Participate in School Events:\*\*** Actively participate in school events and activities, contributing to the school's community and culture.

**- \*\*Classroom Management:\*\*** Maintain a clean, organized, and safe classroom environment that supports learning and creativity.

**- \*\*Professional Development:\*\*** Engage in continuous professional development opportunities offered by the school to enhance your teaching skills.

**- \*\*Foster Inclusivity:\*\*** Create and maintain a safe, inclusive classroom environment that respects and accommodates all children.

**- \*\*Support Emotional Growth:\*\*** Encourage and facilitate children's social and emotional development through positive interactions and activities.

**- \*\*Adapt Teaching Strategies:\*\*** Modify teaching strategies to meet the diverse learning needs and styles of all children. ***\*\*Job Requirements:\*\**** **- \*\*Educational Background:\*\*** Minimum of a Diploma in Early Childhood Education or a related field.

**- \*\*Experience:\*\*** At least 1 year of experience in teaching preschool-aged children.

**- \*\*Classroom Management:\*\*** Strong classroom management skills to create a positive and orderly learning environment.

**- \*\*Language Proficiency:\*\*** Fluent in English or Mandarin; fluency in Mandarin is preferred for communication with Mandarin-speaking children.

**- \*\*Personal Qualities:\*\*** Ability to work independently, responsible, hardworking, with a positive attitude.

**- \*\*Knowledge:\*\*** Familiarity with child development theories and best practices.

**- \*\*Team Collaboration:\*\*** Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and school administration to achieve common goals.

**- \*\*Tech Savvy:\*\*** Familiarity with technology and software used for lesson planning and progress tracking. Join us in our mission to inspire and educate the next generation. Apply today and be a part of our dynamic and passionate team! ---

title: Safety and Security Officer (6 months contract)
description:
Job Title: Safety and Security Officer (6 months contract)


Location: Malaysia

**About the Role**


The ideal candidate must be a thought leader with a demonstrated ability to approach Safety, Health, and Environmental (SHE) and Security in innovative and exciting ways. The Safety and Security Specialist has overall responsibility for coordinating Safety and Security compliance and improvement activities. You will work with cross functions to execute the local Strategy and improvement plans to achieve sustainable excellence by reducing injuries, illnesses and environmental impact as measured in the core KPIs.

**Who You Are & What You’ll Do**


You’re a born leader: You have a bias for action that is second to none. You challenge yourself and everyone around you towards a continuous improvement mindset. Influence senior management and drive safety and environmental leadership through line management. You’ll assist the site leader to develop and lead the internal crisis committees and safety committee; support the site leader in leading serious incident investigation and analysis.


You love to win and have fun doing it: You enjoy the process and understand that not only through the technical but through the human experience can great achievements be accomplished. You will manage the teams responsible to deliver Occupational Health, Safety and Environment results. Lead the Pillar in accordance with Manufacturing Excellence Strategy Programs.


You’re a teacher: You strive to show not just the “How” but the “Why” safety is at the utmost importance for yourself and others around you. You will deploy the global/cluster strategy, policy and standards in the site to achieve excellent sustainable results. Drive safety and environment risk assessment and develop/implement appropriate controls. Determine training needs and assist in delivery of training programs.


You’re a culture and change champion: You are a vital part of the winning strategy which delivers the most important part of the site’s goals for the most important resource of any company, personal safety and security. All while moving the Unilever Sustainable Lining Plan (USLP) forward motivating individuals around you to think and act beyond themselves. Reduce the site’s environmental impact.

**Team Structure:**

* Reporting to: SEAA & ANZ SHE Lead & SEAA Supply Chain Security Lead.
* Peer Support: Malaysia SHE Manager.

**Your Role/Key Responsibilities:**

**Safety, Health, and Environmental**

* Deploy the global/cluster SHE strategy, policy and standards in the site to achieve excellent sustainable results.
* Monitor site legal compliance and ensure the site meets all local/national regulatory requirements and Unilever standards, provide advice on national SHE legislation requirements and implement relevant procedures and policies.
* Work closely with Occupational Health personnel to identify and mitigate risks which may lead to occupational ill health.
* Assist Country SHE and Security Manager to develop and lead the internal crisis committees and safety committee; support the site leader in leading serious incident investigation and analysis.
* Support line management in all accident/incident investigations and complete report on time.
* Support on ground for BeSafE implementation and other safety programs and put in place for all necessary actions.
* Conduct trend analysis from incidents, near misses, safe behaviour observations and deep compliance audits.
* Develop and deploy internal SHE audits and inspection systems and participate in audits of other Unilever organizations as required.
* Determine training needs and assist in the delivery of training programs.
* Raise standards and build capabilities in our external partners for SHE (e.g., 3PMs, 3PLs and distributor).

**Security**

* Be the trusted advisor to the country leadership and the point of contact for all security related matters providing leadership and developing a coordinated security approach across the applicable country constantly reviewing operational security risk.
* Analyze existing and emerging threats to people, assets, information and brand; design security architecture to combat these threats in accordance with the legal, statutory, regulatory, contractual and business requirements, industry best practices and technological and environmental trends.
* Manage security vendors and facilitate optimal delivery.
* Represent Unilever at industry forums and participate as a member of industry organizations. Provide and share information related to industry benchmarking and activities with global and regional security leadership.
* Management oversight of Protective Intelligence (Oversee intelligence collection efforts designed to help Unilever avoid the disruptive effects of crime, terrorism).
* Preparing high quality reports including country security incident reporting, intelligence briefing, threats assessments and investigative reports.
* Ensure that sufficient resources are available to effectively implement the security plan.
* Ensure security training and awareness sessions for security staff, vendors/third parties and employees.

**Key Stakeholders:**

**Internal:**

* Safety Team (Global, Cluster), Supply Chain (Regional, local), Customer Development/Sales, Finance, Legal, IT, Marketing, R&D, external suppliers (3PL, 3PM, Distributors), all key stakeholders.

**External:**

* Malaysia government officials and external parties related to SHE.

**Travel:**


50-60% of the time for local travel within East and West Malaysia to distributors, 3PMs, and 3PLs.

**What You’ll Need to Succeed**

* Business Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Environment or equivalent industrial experience.
* Professional certifications in NIOSH, SAP, GMP and GDP, GDPMD.
* Registered Safety and Health with valid certificates.
* Experiences and/or qualification in Corporate Security Management.
* Excellent knowledge of Safety, Health and Environment legislation and standards.
* Work experience in a Safety, Health & Environmental role in a manufacturing facility and an office setting.
* Work experience in Occupational Safety, Health and Environment Management auditing.
* Proven record of accomplishment of analytical thinking and project management.
* Good observation, influencing and auditing skills.
* Demonstrable experience in complex stakeholder management and working in a cross-functional team.
* Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-changing environment.
* MUST BE ABLE TO JOIN BY SEPTEMBER 2024.

**About Unilever:**

*Be part of the world’s most successful, purpose-led business. Work with brands that are well-loved around the world, that improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We promote innovation, big and small, to make our business win and grow; and we believe in business as a force for good. Unleash your curiosity, challenge ideas, and disrupt processes: use your energy to make this happen. Our brilliant business leaders and colleagues provide mentorship and inspiration, so you can be at your best. Every day, many Malaysian households use our products to feel good, look good and get more out of life-giving us a unique opportunity to build a brighter future.*

*Every individual here can bring their purpose to life through their work. Join us and you will be surrounded by inspiring leaders and supportive peers. Among them, you will channel your purpose, bring fresh ideas to the table, and simply be you. As you work to make a real impact on the business and the world, we will work to help you become a better you.*


Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. title: HOUSEPARENT
description:
**The Houseparent** has overall responsibility for creating a safe, secure and learner-centered environment in the school hostel. This position requires frequent and meaningful interactions with students in a variety of settings.

The houseparent will also have 10 – 14 periods of teaching load which will be arranged by the Principal.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

**Academic supervisor:**

* Supervise boarding students during evening study time and assist them with academic questions in order to help them progress academically.
* Tutor English Writing and Reading comprehension skills to boarding students in groups or individually every time a teacher points that students need extra-curricular support in the areas mentioned above.
* Keep accurate records of content and topics covered for academic support for boarding students.
* Keep constant communication with boarding students' teachers in order to assure continuous and sustainable progress.
* Communicate with the principal and produce reports on a weekly basis of extra-curricular/academic support provided.
* Assist and support teachers deliver and monitor the Residential Life / Boarding Academic Programme.
* Assist and supervise boarding students on weekend activities such as sports, self-study, field trips and other activities that demand supervision.

**Houseparent**

* Have a good understanding and working knowledge of the Standards for Boarding Schools.
* Supervise the Assistant Houseparent including clear roles and responsibilities, and periodic Performance Management Review.
* Develop and manage the Student Leaders, so that they can play an effective leadership role in House.
* Keep suitable records of students’ progress, welfare, health, emotional problems, achievements and misconduct.
* Ensure that all stakeholders understand the aims and objectives of boarding, and the principles on which community life is based.
* Ensure that the personalised needs of each student are identified and communicated to staff as needed, to ensure that student talent and potential are developed and maximised.
* Ensure the safety and security (including emotional) of all students at all times, including meal times, weekends, and on trips; ensure that adequate contingency arrangements are in place.
* You shall perform other duties that may be assigned to you by your supervisor from time to time.

**Requirements**

* Prior experience working with children.
* Ability to meet health and physical requirements of the position.
* Driving records and credit history in good standing.
* Good sense of humour and high personal standards.
* Proactive, Calm under pressure, able to inspire, motivate and support students, parents/carers and colleagues.
* Have sound and proven experience of teaching and working within a boarding environment.
* Proven experience of leading teams of people.
* High standard of written and oral communication.
* Excellent organizational and administrative skills

Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Early Years Teacher
description:
Requirements

* MUST have qualification in Early Childhood Education

⦁ A non-responsibility holding teacher is required to have a contact teaching load of 75% FTE a week.

⦁ Develop year plans, unit plans, and lesson plans.

⦁ Establish and communicate clear objectives for learning activities.

⦁ Incorporate a variety of learning materials and resources.

⦁ Differentiate to meet students' varying needs.

⦁ Instruct and monitor students in the use of learning materials and equipment.

⦁ Use relevant technology to support instruction.

⦁ Observe and evaluate student's performance and development.

⦁ Assign and grade class work, homework, tests and assignments.

⦁ Provide appropriate feedback on work.

⦁ Encourage and monitor the progress of individual students.

⦁ Maintain accurate and complete records of students' progress and development.

⦁ Update all necessary records accurately and completely.

⦁ Support after school activities.

⦁ Perform any duties in supporting students, i.e. language support, remediation etc.

⦁ Prepare required reports on students and activities.

⦁ Manage student behaviour.

⦁ Maintain discipline in accordance with the expectations of the school

⦁ Apply appropriate disciplinary measures where necessary according to the school policies.

⦁ Perform certain pastoral duties including but not limited to student support, counseling students with academic problems, and providing student encouragement.

⦁ Participate in extracurricular activities such as social activities, sporting activities, clubs, and student organizations.

⦁ Attend and participate in faculty and parent meetings

⦁ Communicate necessary information regularly to students, colleagues, and parents regarding student progress and student needs

⦁ Keep up to date with developments in subject area, teaching resources and methods

⦁ Take class attendance

⦁ Participate in school camps and excursions

⦁ Contribute to the academic and social life of the school

⦁ Cover for absent colleagues

⦁ Serve on school committees

⦁ Participate in one after school activity per week

⦁ Take responsibility for the creation and maintenance of a positive work environment.

⦁ Share resources for the benefit of the school programs.

⦁ Set a positive example for students.

⦁ Monitor student uniforms and appearance

⦁ Ensure that activities provide a safe and positive environment.

⦁ Show respect for students, value their individual talents, differentiate according to their abilities, and create opportunities for success

description:
**Duties & Responsibilities:*** To teach early years classes with some administrative duties as directed by your supervisor.
* Teach about 75 percent weekly load; if teaching load is lower, other related responsibilities will be allocated, which may include but are not limited to, school events and student welfare.

 **Requirements:*** Candidate **must** possess at least a bachelor’s degree in **Early Years Childhood.**
* Can work in Cheras, Kuala Lumpur.
* Excellent command of English in both written and spoken.
* At least 3 years of teaching experience in a school setting.
* Good communication skills and time management skills. Willing to work in a team and follow instructions given.
* Dedicated and passionate about education. Able to work extra hours when required.
* Having a positive attitude, with a friendly and outgoing personality

  

Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  

  

**About UCSI International School Sdn Bhd:**  

  

The UCSI Schools Group has 3 campuses in Malaysia: Kuala Lumpur Campus, Subang Jaya Campus and Springhill Campus. Two of its campuses focuses on British school curriculum while the other one focuses on the IB.While maintaining a strong focus on core curriculum which includes British school curriculum with Cambridge IGCSE and International Primary Curriculum, we aim to complement the formal curriculum with a series of CCAs which students’ experiences form a cornerstone of their holistic education for the 21st century. The rapid advancement of technological innovations, global competition, and a push towards a knowledge-based economy require that our students learn to have a repertoire of soft and hard skills to enable them to succeed in a future economy that is still in the making. Through our unique CCA experiences, our students can exhibit soft skills like creativity, leadership abilities, teamwork, flexibility, communication skills, resilience and an enterprising spirit that will enable them to stay relevant for the future.UCSI International School focuses on eight critical characteristics in our learning content and experiences. The rapid advancement of technological innovation, global competition, and a push towards a knowledge-based economy require that our students have a repertoire of soft and hard skills. We therefore place a strong emphasis on Character Education, Global Citizen Skills, Problem-based Collaborative Learning, and co-curricular activities amongst others, forming a truly holistic education for the 21st century.Our emphasis in education isn’t only labelled in academic and creative excellence, but to equipped students with 21st century skills such as character, communication, collaboration, creativity, critical thinking, while inculcating virtues such as integrity, honesty, and empathy in our students. We believe that students that have a developed moral compass and practical wisdom in a challenging and fractured world will make a positive impact for life.

title: QA Lead Analyst
description:
**Job Summary:**

The QA Lead Analyst is responsible for leading the quality assurance efforts of a project, ensuring that all software products meet the highest standards of quality. This role involves designing and implementing testing strategies, mentoring QA team members, and working closely with development teams to identify and address defects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. **Leadership and Team Management:**

o Lead and mentor a team of QA analysts, providing guidance, support, and feedback.

o Assign tasks, set priorities, and manage the workload to ensure timely completion of testing activities.

o Facilitate communication between QA, development, and project management teams.

2. **Test Planning and Strategy:**

o Develop comprehensive test plans and strategies that cover all aspects of software quality, including functionality, performance, security, and usability.

o Define test scope, objectives, and resources required for each project.

o Ensure that testing processes are aligned with project timelines and deliverables.

3. **Test Execution and Reporting:**

o Oversee the execution of manual and automated tests, ensuring thorough coverage of all test cases.

o Identify, document, and track defects, working closely with development teams to resolve them.

o Provide detailed test reports, including metrics on test coverage, defect density, and overall product quality.

4. **Process Improvement:**

o Continuously evaluate and improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the testing efforts.

o Implement best practices for testing and quality assurance, including the adoption of new technologies and tools.

o Drive initiatives to automate repetitive testing tasks and improve the overall speed and accuracy of testing.

5. **Collaboration and Communication:**

o Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and product managers, to understand project requirements and expectations.

o Participate in project planning meetings and provide input on quality and risk management.

o Communicate testing progress, issues, and risks to stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment.

6. **Risk Management:**

o Identify potential risks to product quality and work proactively to mitigate them.

o Develop and maintain a risk-based testing approach, focusing on critical areas of the software.

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**

· **Technical Skills:**

o Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, tools, and processes.

o Experience with both manual and automated testing.

o Proficiency in test automation tools (e.g., Selenium, JUnit, TestNG) and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Java).

o Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.

· **Analytical Skills:**

o Excellent problem-solving abilities with a keen eye for detail.

o Ability to analyze complex software systems and design appropriate test strategies.

· **Experience:**

o Several years of experience in software quality assurance, with a significant portion in a leadership role.

o Experience in testing complex, multi-tiered systems.

· **Education:**

o Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Equivalent experience may be considered.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

· Certifications such as ISTQB Certified Tester, Advanced Level (CTAL) or similar.

· Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., LoadRunner, JMeter).

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


**Why choose Logicalis?**

  

As Architects of Change, Logicalis' focus is to design, support and execute clients' digital transformation by uniting their vision with their technology expertise and industry insights. The company, through its deep understanding of key IT industry drivers such as security, cloud, data management and IoT, can address customer priorities such as revenue growth and business, operational efficiency, innovation, risk and compliance, data governance and sustainability.

  

We strengthen our purpose: to design, support, and execute our customers' digital transformation by converging their vision with our technological expertise and knowledge of the industry. The brand refresh underpins both the evolution of Logicalis’ positioning as well as our strategic vision for growth.


**Responsibilities:**

This is a varied business facing role, with the following responsibilities:


* Maintain overall instances of Salesforce administration (Sales Cloud, Sales Einstein and Pardot) and platform tasks include user and license management, system configuration, change control, and enhancements.
* Maintain security such as user accounts/roles/profiles/permission, sharing rules, field level security, content folder rights, groups, list view rights.
* Act as the go-to for local Salesforce Users and regional Salesforce Admins.
* Manage service requests and troubleshoot issues, working with diverse user groups and their business leads delivering quality support via ticket system.
* Present changes/system enhancements, integration opportunities and overall training to diverse audiences.
* Assists in conducting training of Business Owners for new features and helps with roll-out.
* Manage mass imports and exports of data.
* Undertake additional projects as directed by management.
	+ Identify and gather requirements from users and stakeholders.
	+ Interact directly with managers and end users as necessary to analyse project objectives and capability requirements.
	+ Communicate with project managers, users and other business application developers to design solution integration strategies and ensure successful application integration.
	+ Work together with development team (outsourced) to develop customized solutions within Salesforce platform to support business functions and meet management objectives, business requirements, and company goals.
	+ Write training document and provide user training for newly developed functionality.
	+ Monitor user adoption.
	+ Test stability and functionality of the application.


**Requirements:**

* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.
* Salesforce product knowledge and 3 years hands-on administration experience with Sales Cloud.
* Understanding of Salesforce sharing and security (roles, profiles, permissions, OWD, sharing rules).
* Ability to perform Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Workflow, Process Builder, fields, page layouts, record types, custom settings, dashboards, and reports.
* Good communication skills.
* A proactive attitude to platform enhancements.
* A desire to implement best practice solutions.
* Available and responsive to questions.
* Excellent relationship-building skills and ability to liaise with stakeholders at all levels.



Interested applicants please submit your application with your expected salary and notice period to be considered for the role. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.



As part of any recruitment process, we collect and processes personal data relating to job applicants. We are committed to being transparent about how we collect and use that data and to meeting our data protection obligations. By

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
**Job Description**:

We are seeking a talented Full Stack Developer who can proficiently work across both frontend and backend technologies to develop and maintain comprehensive software solutions. The ideal candidate will have expertise in a wide range of technologies, including but not limited to ***Angular 2, React JS, Spring Boot, Microservices, JBoss, Apache HTTP Server, Maven, Oracle SQL, and MS SQL***. They should be able to work independently and collaboratively within a team environment to deliver high-quality, scalable, and maintainable software products.

**Responsibilities:**

1. Design, develop, and implement both frontend and backend components of software

applications.

2. Develop user-facing features using Angular 2 and React JS, ensuring the responsiveness and performance of the application.

3. Build server-side components and Microservices using Spring Boot, adhering to best practices for scalability and reliability.

4. Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.

5. Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code for both frontend and backend components.

6. Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.

7. Implement security and data protection measures.

8. Work with databases including Oracle SQL and MS SQL to design schemas, write optimized queries, and ensure data integrity.

9. Configure and maintain application servers such as JBoss and Apache HTTP Server.

10. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies, and proactively suggest improvements to enhance product quality and efficiency.

**Requirements**:

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience working as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.
* Proficiency in frontend technologies such as Angular 2, React JS, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Strong backend development skills using technologies like Spring Boot, Microservices, and JBoss.
* Experience with database management systems, including Oracle SQL and MS SQL.
* Familiarity with build tools like Maven and version control systems such as Git.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience with Agile development methodologies is preferred.

***If you possess the skills and qualifications outlined above and are passionate about delivering high quality software solutions, we encourage you to apply for this position.***

title: Senior Node.js Developer
description:
**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Node.js Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing scalable and efficient backend solutions using Node.js. As a Senior Node.js Developer, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high quality software products that meet the needs of our clients and end-users.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and implement robust and scalable backend solutions using Node.js
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code
* Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic
* Implement Unit test to ensure the quality and reliability of the codebase
* Optimize application performance and scalability
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in backend development
* Mentor junior developers and contribute to their growth and development

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master's degree preferred)
* 5+ years of experience in backend development using ***Node.js***
* Proficiency in ***JavaScript/TypeScript*** and knowledge of modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries
* Experience with relational databases e.g., MsSQL Server
* Strong understanding of ***microservices architecture and RESTful API*** design principles
* Nice to have experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
* Proficiency in using process management tools such as PM2 for monitoring, managing, and scaling Node.js applications in production environments
* Familiarity with popular Node.js libraries and frameworks such as Express.js, Socket.IO, Koa, Nest.js, or Hapi.js
* Experience with authentication and authorization mechanisms such as **J\*\_**WT, OAuth, or Passport.js\*\_
* Knowledge of asynchronous programming and handling of asynchronous operations in Node.js using Promises, async/await, or callbacks
* Understanding of event-driven architecture and proficiency in using EventEmitter and other event driven patterns in Node.js applications
* Experience with testing frameworks such as Mocha, Chai, Jest, or Jasmine for writing unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests for Node.js applications
* Knowledge of caching mechanisms such as ***Redis or Hazelcast*** for improving the performance and scalability of Node.js applications
* Understanding of security best practices and techniques for securing Node.js applications against common vulnerabilities such as SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, and DDOS attacks
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for CI/CD pipelines, automated deployments, and infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, CircleCI, or Travis CI
* Knowledge of GraphQL and experience with implementing GraphQL APIs using tools such as Apollo Server or GraphQL Yoga
* Understanding of WebSocket protocols and proficiency in using WebSockets for real-time communication in Node.js applications
* Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes for deploying and managing Node.js applications in containerized environments
* Strong understanding of performance optimization techniques for Node.js applications, including profiling, caching, lazy loading, and minimizing I/O operations

**Note:** While expertise in all of the above areas is not required, familiarity with a majority of these concepts and tools will be beneficial for the successful execution of the role.

*If you are a talented and motivated individual with a passion for backend development and a desire to make an impact, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of banking industry with innovative technology solutions.*

Job Type: Permanent

* Professional development

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Performance bonus

title: ETL Developer (Junior-Mid level)
description:
ETL PENTAHO DEVELOPER ENGINEER

As a ETL Engineer, you will be responsible for extracting and ingesting data from websites using web crawling tools. In this role you will own the creation process of these tools, services, and workflows to improve crawl/ scrape analysis, reports, and data management.

We will rely on you to test the data and the scrape to ensure accuracy and quality. You will own the process to identify and rectify any issues with breaks as well as scale scrapes as needed.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Should be able to perform data extraction, data loading solving the errors, checking filter criteria.
* Understanding on the steps - input, output, and connection to database.
* Understanding on job/transformation, inspecting the data.
* Understanding on salesforce basics - fields, objects, and lookups
* Knowledge on schema, database, views.
* Provide technical knowledge/expertise to support the requirements definition, design, and development of data warehouse components/subsystems, specifically Extract-Transform Load or Extract-Load-Transform technologies and implementations and/or Change Data Capture technologies and implementations.
* Getting fallout report and analyzing the bugs and errors, should understand how to get output file.
* Research, design, develop, and modify the ETL and related database functions, implementing changes/enhancements to the system.
* Design ETL processes and develop source to target transformations, and load processes.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field or the equivalent demonstrated experience
* *Must have* ***ETL Pentaho*** *experience*
* Experience running large scale web scrapes.
* Experience with Linux/UNIX, HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, and Networking
* Experience with techniques and tools for crawling, extracting, and processing data.
* Great communication skills (written and spoken in English)

**Good to have**:

* *Familiarity with system monitoring/administration tools*
* *Familiarity with version control, open-source practices, and code review*
* *Familiarity with Python*

title: Project Manager (Software Development
description:
We are looking to hire a positive, proactive Project Manager to oversee the project management team (3 project executives) and to ensure IT projects are completed on time and smoothly. Coordinate the utilization of resources across divisions (UIUX designers, developers and QA tester ) of the project to reach targets. The Project Manager will ensure compliance with budget, timeline and other project requirements. You will manage the project team members and communicate with stakeholders (client, outsource, internal teams) during all phases of the project, and close it efficiently.

To be successful in this role you should deliver an extensively recorded, tested, intact, and operative project within delivery time frames and budget. Ideal candidates will be attentive, detailed and have a positive demeanor.

**Job Description/Responsibilities**

Project Planning: Work closely with the sales & development team to develop project plans, including scope/requirement, proposal, timelines, and resource allocation. Define project goals, milestones, and deliverables.  
Team Management: Lead and motivate project teams. Conduct weekly WIP meeting to provide guidance and direction to team members; identify and solve existing and potential blockers.  
Resource Management: Allocate resources efficiently and manage team workloads. Ensure the availability of necessary documents and information for the projects.  
Risk Management: Identify potential project risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Proactively address issues as they arise.  
Quality Assurance: Oversee the testing and quality assurance processes from the QA team to ensure that software meets the specified requirements and standards.  
Communication & Engagement: Maintain regular communication/engagement with clients/outsource parties/internal members to gather project requirements, provide updates, and address concerns.  
Budget Control: Monitor project budgets and expenditures, making sure that projects stay within the allocated financial limits and timeline.  
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, job brief, status reports, and change requests.  
Project Delivery: Ensure on-time and within-budget project delivery, meeting all project requirements and quality standards.  
Post-mortem: Conduct project post-mortem and evaluate project and team performance.  
RFP Preparation: Attend to project RFP/RFQ/tender and prepare comprehensive proposals.  
Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Qualifications and Skills:**  
Candidates must possess at least Diploma/Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Project Management or related professions.  
Minimum 3 years of experience in the Development/Project Management/Account Management or relevant discipline.  
With solid experience of software development processes, methodologies and project management tools (eg: Asana)  
Strong leadership and team management skills, with a proven track record of successful project delivery.  
Possess good communication skills and confidence in communicating to all stakeholders from various backgrounds.  
Good management, negotiation, written, verbal and presentation skills.  
Problem-solving, results-oriented, self-motivated, adaptability, attentive and detailed.  
Ability to work on own initiative with minimal supervision, good time management, priorities and organizational skills to work on multi-tasks with high sense of urgency.  
Able to tolerate stress and work multiple projects within the company’s project portfolio simultaneously.

title: Mobile App Developer (Flutter)
description:
**Job Description:**

title: Project Secretary
description:
**Key Responsibilities (included but not limited to):**

* **Talent Acquisition & Matching:** Source, screen, and interview potential candidates for the requested roles. Understand and match candidates’ skills, experiences, and preferences to the right job opportunities. Present suitable candidates to the client companies and facilitate the interview process between the two parties.
* **Client Engagement:** Work closely with companies and clients to understand their staffing needs, culture, and requirements. Establish strong relationships with clients to effectively manage their recruitment needs.
* **Negotiation:** Negotiate job offers, including salary, benefits, and other terms, on behalf of both the candidate and the employer. They help to ensure that both parties are satisfied with the terms of the employment.
* **Market Knowledge:** Stay updated with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in the recruitment arena. Attend relevant seminars, workshops, and networking events to foster relationships and gain industry insights.
* **Stakeholder Management**: Building and maintaining strong relationships with both clients and candidates is crucial. This helps establish trust and ensures that the consultant is a reliable partner in the recruitment process. Offer constructive feedback to candidates post-interviews and provide guidance for potential future opportunities.
* **Feedback and Improvement:** After candidates are placed, often seek feedback from both parties to continuously improve their matching process and enhance client and candidate satisfaction.
* **Administration:** Handle administrative tasks such as documentation, contract management, and compliance with employment laws and regulations. Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant employment laws.
* **Networking:** Attending HR and recruitment industry events, conferences, and meetups can help expand your professional network and stay connected with key players in the industry.

***Requirements***

* Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, or related field. (Relevant experience can be considered in lieu of a formal degree.)
* Minimum 3 years experience in tech recruitment or similar roles.
* Proficient in using ATS and other recruitment software
* Excellent understanding of the tech landscape, including specific roles such as software developers, data scientists, network engineers, etc.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with team members, clients, and stakeholders.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
* Self-motivated, proactive, and results-driven.

***Benefits***

**Competitive compensation package**

* Basic Salary + Parking Credit
* Other allowances where applicable (petrol, toll, meals etc.)
* Performance based bonuses and sales commissions available

**Comprehensive fringe benefits** 

* Healthcare and wellbeing packages (medical, dental, optical etc.)
* Employee wellness initiatives (trips, gatherings, dinners etc.)
* Annual leave, sick leave, emergency leave provided (determined by length of service)

**Professional growth** 

* Career advancement and promotion opportunities.
* Support for attending function related seminars, courses, events etc.
* Exposure to digitization through exploration of various softwares.

**Office Environment**

* Open concept workstation
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the company’s growth and success.
* Fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: RM2,500.00 - RM3,500.00 per month

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Tech Lead (LCNC)
description:
**Position Title: Tech Lead**

**Industry: IT Software Solution**

**Location: Bangsar South**

**Job Overview:**

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Tech Lead for Low Code/No Code Development to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development, extensive experience with low code/no code platforms, and a proven track record of leading development teams. As a Tech Lead, you will be responsible for guiding the development of innovative software solutions, ensuring best practices, and driving project success.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* **Leadership and Team Management:** Lead and mentor a team of developers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment.
* **Technical Expertise:** Provide expert guidance on low code/no code platforms.
* **Project Oversight:** Oversee the design, development, and deployment of low code/no code applications, ensuring projects are delivered on time and within budget.
* **Best Practices:** Establish and enforce coding standards, best practices, and development methodologies to maintain high-quality code and efficient workflows.
* **Solution Architecture:** Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and maintainable software solutions.
* **Innovation:** Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies, recommending and implementing innovative solutions to enhance our development capabilities.
* **Quality Assurance:** Ensure thorough testing and quality assurance processes are in place to deliver reliable and robust applications.
* **Client Engagement:** Work closely with clients to gather requirements, provide technical insights, and deliver exceptional customer service.

**Qualifications & Experiences Needed:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 7 years of experience in software development, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
* **Low Code/No Code Expertise:** Extensive experience with low code/no code platforms such as Mendix, OutSystems, Microsoft Power Apps, or similar.
* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python, C#), database management, and integration technologies.
* **Leadership Skills:** Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team of developers.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* **Problem-Solving:** Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on delivering innovative and efficient solutions.
* **Agile Methodologies:** Experience with Agile development methodologies and project management tools.

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
At Toku, we create bespoke cloud communications and customer engagement solutions to reimagine customer experiences for enterprises. We provide an end-to-end approach to help businesses overcome the complexity of digital transformation in APAC markets and enhance their CX with mission-critical cloud communication solutions. Toku combines local strategic consulting expertise, bespoke technology, regional in-country infrastructure, connectivity and global reach to serve the diverse needs of enterprises operating regionally.



As we continue creating momentum for our products in the APAC region and helping customers with their communications needs, we are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to ensure the high quality and reliability of our cutting-edge contact center and unified communication platforms, and contribute to the seamless delivery of exceptional customer experiences.



This is a newly created and impactful position during a growth phase for the business. You will be instrumental in shaping new processes, bringing new ideas and selecting tools in a collaborative and highly visible team environment. You will thrive in this role if you have a passion for quality, an eye for detail, and the experience to help excel a growing QA function to the next level.

 **Expected Collaborations**


* Work closely with the QA Manager to align on testing strategies, priorities, and goals for the team.
* Partner with Test Automation Engineers to communicate requirements, design test plans, and ensure the integration of automated tests into the development pipeline.
* Engage with Product Managers to understand product requirements and provide feedback on testability and potential quality issues.
* Work support teams to understand, investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.



Tasks and Responsibilities


**Delivery**


* Lead the quality assurance efforts for our software products, ensuring that they meet the highest standards of performance, reliability, and user experience.
* Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
* Estimate, prioritize, plan, and coordinate quality testing activities.
* Execute automation scripts using open-source tools.
* Conduct regression, integration, and performance testing after bugs are resolved.


**Strategy Alignment**


* Ability to analyze complex software systems and understand how different components interact.
* Collaborate with customer support teams to investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and ensure delivery of high-quality product.
* Continuous Improvement: Advocate for and implement best practices in QA processes and methodologies. Participate in process improvement initiatives and contribute to enhancing the overall QA strategy.
* Stay up to date with new testing tools and test strategies.


**Talent**


* Actively participate in knowledge sharing and contribute to the growth and development of the QA team.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior QA engineers, offering support and training to enhance their skills and performance.


**Culture**


* Maintain excellent interpersonal skills, with strong written and oral communication abilities in English.
* Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.
* Effectiveness in working with development, QA, and customer support teams.
* Foster a continuous learning mindset, staying up-to-date with the latest QA trends and technologies.


**Technical Excellence**


* Contribution to the adoption of new testing tools and strategies, and continuous improvement of testing processes.
* Test Strategy Development: Develop comprehensive test strategies and plans based on product requirements and specifications, including functional, performance, and regression testing.
* Test Coverage: The percentage of the codebase covered by automated tests.
* Manual Testing: Perform thorough manual testing as per Requirements, including exploratory and user acceptance testing
* Defect Management: Identify, document, and track defects using bug tracking systems (e.g., Jira). Work closely with developers to reproduce issues and verify fixes.
* Documentation: Create and maintain detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts. Ensure accurate documentation of test results and defect reports.
* Escaping Defects: Maintain the history of the defects that escaped to production and identify the ways to avoid it.
* Execution of Scripts: Execute the automated tests which are developed using Frameworks such as Selenium, SIP protocol test tool


**We would love to hear from you if you have:**


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field. Any relevant certifications (e.g., ISTQB) are a plus.
* At least 5 years of work experience in software quality assurance or software testing
* Knowledge in industry leading test automation tools such as Selenium, Junit, Test NG, Cucumber tool or SIP and VOIP is a plus .
* In-depth knowledge of various types of testing, including functional, regression, performance, and security testing.
* Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work under pressure. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential.
* Continuous learning mindset, staying up to date with the latest QA trends and technologies.
* Experience in CcaaS, CPaaS, Telco or Voice related domains is an added bonus for this role.


**If you would love to experience working in a start-up growing at an accelerated speed, and you think you tick most of the requirements, come join us!**

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

We are recruiting an experienced Backend Software Engineer to join our team. The candidate will play a key role in designing, implementing, and maintaining the backend layers of our digital asset custody platform.

**Responsibilities**

* Design, build, and maintain backend services for digital asset custody, including trade matching, transaction execution, accounting, and risk management functionalities
* Collaborate with product managers, blockchain developers, and security experts to develop secure and scalable backend solutions
* Implement APIs and integrate with blockchain infrastructure to ensure high availability and reliability of our custody systems
* Write test scripts, set up monitoring and logging infrastructure, and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to digital asset custody

**Qualifications & Requirements**

* At least 5+ years of software development experience, with a focus on backend development
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* Proficiency in Golang as well as other modern high-level languages
* Strong understanding of blockchain technology, cryptographic principles, and digital asset security
* Experience working in the financial services industry, preferably in digital asset custody or blockchain-related projects
* Familiarity with Linux environments, SQL, and relational databases
* Self-motivated, capable of working independently and collaboratively in a fast- paced environment
* Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritise tasks effectively
* Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively with cross- functional teams

**Application Instructions** 

To proceed with your application, you will need to upload your CV and complete the required questionnaires. Click on the corresponding link to get started:

title: Senior Media Software Developer (Java)
description:
**Responsibilities:** 

As part of an agile team, you are responsible for developing software of products in the media industry.

* Responsible for software development, change, bugfix and support on Arvato Systems’ media software products
* Defines scope, plans and deliverables for assigned work packages
* Collects detailed business, user and technical requirements. Works with others to analyze collected requirements, translate into programming solutions, and ensure that identified solutions meet product owner’s expectations
* Administer development and production environments
* Maintains security, integrity, and business continuity controls and documents
* Builds knowledge on emerging tools, broadcast industry, techniques and technologies

**Requirements:** 

Must Have:

* Technical experience on the following:

- 5 years in Java programming

- 3 years in web and application server, e.g. Apache, JBoss/Wildfly

- 2 years in cloud-based application development and cloud services

- 1 year in agile software development

- Experienced with ORM, e.g. Hibernate with JPA

- Experienced in Microsoft SQL database

- Experienced in software testing approach, e.g. JUnit

- Experienced with GIT

* Willingness to learn, a can-do attitude, and motivation to succeed and grow
* Good analytical, problem solving and organization skills
* Strong sense of responsibility and great teamwork practitioner
* Ability to adapt and apply rapidly changing technology to business needs
* Autonomous, engaged and quality-oriented working
* Fluent in English (both written & verbal)

Optional but great plus:

* Familiarity with artificial intelligence (AI) concepts
* Experienced with build tools, e.g. Ant and Maven
* Experienced with build servers, e.g. Jenkins
* Experienced with Azure CI/CD
* Domain knowledge in Media & Broadcasting sector
* Experience in work collaboration with remote teams or large organization

**Life at Arvato Systems Malaysia:**

Are you ready to join a team that continuously nurtures creativity, champions entrepreneurship, and values every individual's contribution? Our agile and collaborative culture cultivates empowerment through ownership, trust, and respect. Within this environment, we innovate through value creation and delving into technology, shaping boundless possibilities in our ecosystem.

**What's in it for YOU:**

* **Innovate Fearlessly:** We fearlessly challenge the status quo. Innovation runs deep within our core, and we're continually seeking groundbreaking solutions. Your ideas matter, and we offer the platform for them to flourish.
* **Invest in Growth:** We prioritize your professional development with diverse learning, mentorship, and resources nurturing your growth through ample training opportunities.
* **Work-Life Harmony:** At our company, we prioritize work-life harmony, championing flexibility, and support to ensure your welfare. Your mental wellness is our priority. We're committed to fostering a healthy balance between work and personal life for a happier, healthier you.
* **Attractive Benefits:** Our flexible benefits package is designed to cater to your individual needs, complemented by exclusive perks such as Birthday Leave, Family Care Leave, and sponsored meals.
* **Collaboration over Competition:** Teamwork isn't just an idea here - it's our way of life.
* **Thriving on Diversity:** Embracing unique viewpoints and backgrounds, we ensure Equity and Inclusivity are at the heart of our success.
* **Celebrate Success:** From big wins to small victories, every achievement deserves its moment in the spotlight. From project milestones to personal goals and team triumphs, we're all about raising the flag high for success!
* **Wellness & Well-being are Fundamental:** We view wellness as more than personal health - it's the foundation of our caring, connected community. This emphasis on well-being drives our culture of rapid exploration and learning, propelling us forward together.
* **Uniting through Fun:** From annual company trips to quarterly team outings, we build trust and camaraderie by engaging in enjoyable activities together.
* **Giving Back:** Rooted in our values, we actively engage in initiatives supporting meaningful causes that benefit society. Our commitment to Corporate Responsibility is the cornerstone of our journey toward excellence.

Join Arvato Systems Malaysia for a transformative career journey. Our commitment to fair opportunities means we value skills and performance above all else - everyone is welcome to build a brighter future together.

**About Sigma School:**

Sigma School is dedicated to providing comprehensive coding education. Our mission is to empower individuals with the skills and practical knowledge needed to succeed in today's tech-driven world. We are currently seeking an enthusiastic Coding Instructor to lead our evening web development classes and inspire the next generation of software developers.

As a Coding Instructor, you will be responsible for delivering engaging and effective instruction in web development. Are you a seasoned professional with a passion for mobile technology and software testing? Join our innovative banking team as a Mobile Lead Developer. In this role, you'll lead the charge in developing and testing cutting-edge mobile applications.

Your responsibilities will include:

**Mobile Technology Development:** Expertise in Android native (Kotlin) and iOS native (Swift) development.

**Hybrid App Development:** Proficiency with EmberJS, ReactJS, Flutter, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML.

**Software Testing:** Extensive experience in performance testing, ensuring high-quality and efficient mobile applications.

**Clean Code Practices:** Knowledge of MVVM, MVP, DDD, and design patterns for writing clean, maintainable code.

**Version Control:** Strong experience with Version Control Systems, particularly Gitflow.

**Agile Methodologies:** Hands-on experience with Scrum and Kanban for efficient project management.

**Financial Web and API Development:** Deep experience in developing secure, internet-facing financial web applications and APIs.

**CI/CD:** Proficiency in Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment processes to streamline development.

Why Join Us?

**Innovative Projects:** Work on state-of-the-art mobile technology in the financial sector.

**Growth Opportunities:** Potential for contract extension and career advancement.

**Collaborative Environment:** Be part of an agile and dynamic team dedicated to excellence.

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: From RM9,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Maternity leave
* Opportunities for promotion
* Parental leave
* Professional development

Schedule:

* Day shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Performance bonus
* Yearly bonus

Experience:

* Software Testing: 7 years (Required)
* Performance Testing: 3 years (Required)

title: Web Programmer #67967 (Work in Singapore)
description:
**Job Description**

* Industry/ Organization Type: Design/ Lifestyle
* Position Title: **Web Programmer/ Web Developer**
* Working Location: Serangoon Garden
* Working Hours: **5 days, Tuesday to Saturday (9 am – 6 pm)**
* Salary Package: **Basic + Bonus (Depends on Performance)**
* Duration: Permanent

**Key Responsibilities**

* Build, develop, and maintain the company website with a focus on advanced web design and user experience.
* Implement responsive design principles to ensure the website functions seamlessly across various devices and screen sizes.
* Optimize website performance, including load times and accessibility compliance.
* Design and develop interactive and immersive experiences within the metaverse, incorporating advanced 3D design and virtual reality elements.
* Collaborate with the team to conceptualize, plan, and execute innovative projects within the metaverse.
* Write clean, maintainable code (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.).
* Integrate front-end and back-end systems.
* Apply strong 3D design skills to create visually appealing and functional digital environments.
* Debug and upgrade existing systems.
* Work with teams to meet project deadlines.
* Contribute creative ideas to enhance user experience.
* Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies.

**APPLY NOW!!!**

* At least a Diploma in Computer Science or related field.
* Minimum 1 year of related working experience in web development and advanced web design.
* Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React or Angular.
* Experience with 3D design software (Blender, Maya).
* Strong UX/UI understanding.

Please apply through **ANY** of the following methods:

* Submit your application by clicking the **APPLY** button;
* Email your resume to Job(at)anradus.com.sg. Please indicate **#67967** on the email subject.

**Anradus Application Policy:** We value each application and ensure every resume is reviewed. Our process is efficient, typically concluding within **3 working days**. If you do not receive communication from us within this timeframe, it's likely that your application has not been shortlisted by our client. In such cases, we recommend continuing your job search to maximize your opportunities.

Anradus Pte Ltd | EA License No. 20C0161 | Adelin Chong | EA Reg No.: R1875641

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: RM12,000.00 - RM15,000.00 per month

Application Question(s):
